response.overview: An old scholar, who has lived in his own metaphysical world, reflects on life, death, and love, after his wife has an accident and as he senses the approaching death. The film provides a glimpse into the hidden life of Kim Uchang, a humanist who has exerted the most profound influence on modern South Korean intellectual history, and presents a depiction, focusing on love, of the clumsiness and irony behind the old scholar’s ​​seemingly wise and perfect life. A story uncovered from the daily life of Kim Uchang that would deliver profound lessons, warming humor, and wisdom about life. Here is his history that the director has traced for nineteen years.
response.tagline: 19-year cinematic footprint of Kim Uchang, South Korea's leading humanist
response.title: In the Sea of Strange Thoughts
